snippet: At a ceremony to honor the former Oakland running back Clem Daniels, players and John Madden said there had long been rewards for hard hitting in a violent sport.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column on Oakland Raiders ceremony honoring former running back Clem Daniels, four-time AFL All-Star who played for the Raiders from 1961 to 1967; recalls the Raiders' reputation for rough-and-tough football; holds that fairly or not, the team long ago became a symbol of renegade mentality in professional football.
lead_paragraph: At a ceremony to honor the former Oakland running back Clem Daniels, players and John Madden said there had long been rewards for hard hitting in a violent sport.

headline.seo: Old Raiders Say Football Has Always Been a Tough Game
headline.main: The Old Raiders Didn’t Need Bounties to Be Brutal
headline.print_headline: The Old Raiders Didn’t Need Bounties to Be Brutal
